embeds.title: Act I - Chapter 3: The Lighthouse
embeds.description: All four of you sleep in later than usual, the late night after long travel taking its toll.  Ruggo, you awake first, and the realization hits you that the jobs are likely to hit the board any time now, and you have yet to report to Captain Reynolds.  You hastily dress and gather your things and make your way to the lobby, hoping that your companions are already there waiting for you.  Unfortunately, they are not - though it seems Lyla is back at work, and she greets to with a smile as you burst into the lobby.

*Rowan gives Lyla a warm grin and a wink.* 

"Mornin' Lyla, trust yer day off was enjoyed? And much deserved."

embeds.title: Lyla
embeds.description: "It was enjoyed indeed!  Perhaps a little too much, if I'm being completely honest - but the pleasant weather and sunshine go a long way to curing that, 'least for me.  Glad you and your companions made it back alright - word is, a lot of the other adventurers didn't fare as well."
*Leaning his elbows on the desk and in a whisper,* "That right? What's the word on that exactly?"

embeds.title: Lyla
embeds.description: "Well, it's not that the Lances really come tell the innkeeper about these things, but I overheard talk that several of the adventuring parties sent out recently haven't returned.  And the Sword _is_ quite a bit emptier than it was a tenday ago."

"That's a shame... damn shame. Well I'm headin' to the job board to see if there's anything doin'. Me and my crew might be back tonight to make use of the lovely service here, so don't you worry." 

*Rowan stands up and heads to the door.*

"If yeh see the others, wouldya tell em to meet me there? You have a wonderful day Lyla."

*Storm wakes up feeling extra refreshed. He lays in bed relaxing, glad to hear it isn't raining today. Thoughts of the Tower of Thalivar come to mind and last night's adventure. Storm realizes how much he enjoys lore and perhaps that's why this whole mystery intrigues him.*

"I am a Bard of Lore I guess." *he says, chuckling to himself*.

*He lays there for a few more moments, slowly waking up with the feeling that there is somewhere he needs to be...

...
...
...

Giving a Tabaxi curse, Storm leaps out of bed and quickly dresses. He packs up his bag and equips all his gear before racing down the maze of hallways to the lobby fearing that he has held everyone up by sleeping in.*

*Storm greets Lyla as he stumbles into the lobby in a hurry.*

"Su'tali Lyla, it was good to see you last night at the Tusk. This one is glad you get time to unwind with friends and have a good time. Did any of my companions make it out yet, please don't tell me I'm the last one!"

_Cain had an uneventful night, and slept quite well despite the close encounter with ... whatever that was, at the Manyclaw Alley. He did sleep with the candles on full light though ..._

_Stretching, he gets out of bed, packs his gear and heads to the front desk just in time to hear Storm's question_

"Ah, perfect timing. I guess we're the first two out."
Lyla's eyes open with surprise as Storm bursts in, followed quickly after by Cain.

embeds.title: Lyla
embeds.description: "Oh, uh, I'm afraid not actually - Rowan has already left, said to let you know that he was going to the job board!"

"Su'tali Cain, hope you slept well and glad to see I am not the last one up."

*Turning to Lyla...* "Thank you again Lyla. Shall we pay now? We are unsure what this day will bring but we need to be at the Lances camp this morning for our report. If we're quick enough, we can catch up to Ruggo."

_Looking out the window and seeing where the sun is, Cain speaks up,_ "We're probably going to miss first picks of the contracts if we were hoping to get a new one. Probably why Rowan went on ahead ... hopefully he gets something good. In the meantime, we should probably wait for Govath."

_Turning to Lyla,_ "Would there be a way to call on him?"

_Govath had woken up at a decent time, only to contemplate why?  It is not often as of late to have a good bed beneath you.  Leaning back into the comfort of the mattress he found himself snoring soundly._
Lyla rings up Bronwyn and asks him to go and knock on the Dwarf's door. He zips off, and a few minutes later, Govath is awoken by the sound.

embeds.title: Bronwyn
embeds.description: "Master Govath, sir, your companions await you in the lobby, and request your presence at your earliest convenience."

"Ah what? Yes yes tell them I will be out shortly."

"Would not do letting them venture by themselves.  That Storm would get into some serious trouble. _Chuckling to himself._  Of which I do not want to miss."

_Govath proceeds to pull himself out of the bed, splash some water on his face and proceed to attempt finding his way to the front lobby._
Perhaps a little more casually than he should, Govath gets up and prepares for the day ahead, eventually joining Cain and Storm in the lobby of The Sword of Leilon.

*Storm waits as patiently as he can but keeps eyeing the front door, hoping Ruggo made out alright with the contracts.*

*Seeing Govath enter, he greets him.*

"Ah Govath, you made it through the maze. Ruggo has gone ahead to the Lance's encampment and we are to meet him there."

_Govath yawns deeply and stretches his back._  "Well ideally we already have our job picked out, it just needs approval from the Lances no?  And payment for our contract is not going anywhere.  But may as well see what Ruggo had found."

"Ruggo is certainly capable enough to pick out the best contract available. This one just hopes he got there before the Reavers did. He seems to have a...history with then. Or at least that Runa one I think. Might be best if he wasn't caught with them alone."

*Turning to Lyla, he bids her a good morning and mentions they will pay later in the day after visiting the Lance's camp. He heads out the door and into the morning sun.*

_Cain nods to Lyla as they head out the door._

"Yeah, Rowan has a thing for that big one Runa. He literally just blushes whenever she's around. You should have seen what he did last night at the bar when they left ... he literally stood up and practically bowed until she left. Govath here made it even more awkward by grilling him about it.", _Cain starts to laugh at the thought._

"It is very strange that he hides his natural indenty with magic whenever he's in Leilon yet doesn't mind being himself outside town or even Gnomengarde. Maybe the whole ruse has soemthing to do with the tall one Runa. 

But he is a good guide. Someone like him would make very decent coin as a jungle guide on Chult."
"Now, I would not say _grilling_, more encouraging to open up more.  He is comfortable among some people, but not all.  As a guide though,  indeed best I have met on my way here."
"We are lucky we don't have to pay him. I wonder if he's getting paid by the Lances."
"That never occurred to me.  He seemed to be in the same boat as us, just been here longer is all."

"I get the impression he is more a freelancer and seems to have an in with the Lances. Perhaps freelanced as a guide for them before. It would be in the interest of the Lances' to hire guides like Ruggo to help adventuring groups for a higher success rate. I wonder if they know he's a Firbolg..."
"Well looks like we have more questions to _grill_ Ruggo with." _Govath grins and winks at Cain and Storm._

The three of you make your way to the town square, where the large tent has been set up for Captain Reynolds to handle the registration and reportings-in of adventuring parties like yourselves.  It seems quieter than when you were last here, only a handful of colourful individuals standing about, but you make your way through the pinned-up flap and find the Captain at his temporary station, the young Squire Geoffrey by his side as before. 
 He finishes taking down the details of a young woman, who then passes you on her way out, and then looks up at the three of you.  He looks even more worn out than before as he addresses you.

embeds.title: Captain Reynolds
embeds.description: "Adventurers, it is a relief to see you have returned safely.  What news from Gnomengarde?  Had they anything to help us in our plight?"

"We have plenty to share, and it was a very successful trip. However, we're missing Rowan ... he came here early to look at the contract board. Has he not come yet? We should wait for him before handing in our report."

embeds.title: Captain Reynolds
embeds.description:
"I'm afraid Rowan has not yet been by - perhaps he is still looking at the job board by the barracks.  If you wish to wait, perhaps I can impart some information to you in the meantime.

Unfortunately, several adventuring parties sent out on recent errands never returned to us.  Some, admittedly, perished at the pursuit of their tasks - a risk that everyone understood from the beginning.  Such is the nature of our work.  Many others, however, fell in a string of attacks by the Dragon itself.  It would seem that the time of sparse sightings and low whispers is past.  The creature has openly presented itself as a very real threat.

The Lances have sent inquiries out in every direction to better ascertain the nature of our adversary, and our contacts in the north have come through for us.  We know both name and nature of the beast - _Cryovain_, they call it.  A fairly young White Dragon originally spotted over the Sea of Moving Ice.  Something has driven it south after a what I'm told is a long period of remaining unseen.  Our scouts have confirmed it seems to have settled somewhere in the eastern peaks - much to the annoyance of the Orc tribes which are known to make their home there, I am sure. 

White Dragons are a primal and aggressive sort, I'm given to understand.  Little matters to them beyond kin, food, and hoard.  We can only assume this recent string of attacks are a display of dominance and a testing of power.  Leilon joins the other cities and towns of the Sword Coast in making preparations for the worst.  But our primary concern must be the safety of our own citizens, so we must rely now more than ever on the generosity of adventurers like yourselves to assist outside of the city walls where needed.  Unfortunately, more have fallen than have registered, these past few days.  And so we have doubled our usual rewards and are allowing each party to take on up to two tasks at a time, should they wish."

"We do wish, Captain..." *Rowan stands at the entrance to the tent with two rolls of parchment in his hand.* "Glad to see the sleepyheads managed to crawl outta bed." *He says with a wink. 

There's something different about Rowan... one of his eyes is now a very dark brown, contrasted to the light brown of the other. Where the light on looks friendly and welcoming, the dark gives him a severe appearance.*

embeds.title: Captain Reynolds
embeds.description: "Ah, Rowan.  I was just apprising your companions of the situation as it stands.  I'm sure they can fill you in on what you've missed.  Now then, I _am_ eager to hear tell of your journey to Gnomengarde."

"Well where to begin.  With the troubling news I suppose is best.  We have a brief update about the dragon, as we had an encounter with it.  Fortunately seeking shelter before it could spot us.  It was however devouring some possibly elf or human, we have a wrist band from them that perhaps you recognize.  We also saw it fly off in a North Eastern direction after finishing its meal."

"Now better news, we cleared the route to Gnomengarde of some harpies to better improve the safety of any future travel or trade with the gnomes.  We can describe how to find your way there to someone familiar with the area.  The gnomes were not particularly excited about us bargaining into their quaint domain, have a trigger happy gnome guarding entrance." _Govath rubs where he got shot in the shoulder._ "They have agreed to aid Leilon and are currently working on developing an automated ballista which we be ready for pick up within the week."

_Turning to the group._ "Anything else I am missing?"

*Storm steps up to the desk.*

"As my companion Govath has mentioned, the ballista will serve as a great defense against Cryovain. The design and construction these Gnomes can do are impressive and dependable. We have also established good relations with the brother Kings of Gnomengarde through helping them solve a serious local problem. In doing so, we received this magically crafted item in return."

*Storm takes off the hat and places it on the desk. He then explains the properties once a caster is attuned.*

"This hat may pose useful to one of your men in an attack or defense against Cryovain. However  if we continue further contracts for the Lances, it would also serve this group as well. The choice is yours Captain, this one is fine with either decision."

"To the point of Govath's report of Cryovain's sighting, our good guide Ruggo here can provide a detailed mark of where we encountered it in its possible hunting area."

*Storm bows and motions for Ruggo to continue the report.*

*Rowan takes off his pack and produces the wristband, the completed job posting, and the pole of collapsing to Captain Reynolds.* 

"Yeah, about a days walk from here towards the entrance to the mountains we encountered that Cryovain. Barely managed to avoid detection but another fella wasn't so lucky. This is the only recoverable piece of clothing, and he did indeed seem to be an elven male." 

*Holding the pole in his hand he says* "Toxasqexdfjh" *and it extends to its 10 ft. Then saying,* "Xasqexdfgh" * it shrinks once more.

"This was gifted by the Gnomes to us personally as reward for killin' a threat that was terrorizing the kingdom. After the run-in with the beast I don't see how it could be used against it, but I leave that to yer discretion. I reckon I could find a use for our travels servin' the Lances goin' forward."

_Once Rowan finishes his report, Cain steps forward and picks up the pole,_ "And the common phrase for this is _compactify_ and _uncompactify_ in case gnomeish is a little hard on the tongue."

_Placing the pole onto the table, he turns and retrieves the wand from his pack._ "We were also given this wand, of which we haven't tested its capabilities. Perhaps one of your magic users could make use of it?"

The Captain patiently listens to your report, occasionally looking down to make a note on the piece of parchment in front of him.  The four of you having spoken, he strokes his beard for a moment and then responds.

embeds.title: Captain Reynolds
embeds.description: "The hat I am confident would be of great use to our few casters.  That being said, if your intention is to continue aiding the Lances in spite of the dire information you have just heard, I see no reason to push you to part with it.  The pole, I am not so confident about.  Nonetheless, it _is_ clearly a magical item and thus I am authorized to give you payment for it if you leave it in our care.  _(Turning to Cain)_ As for this wand, did the Gnomes give no indication of its purpose?"

_Thinking back, he responds,_ "They said it produces harmless, but beautiful, explosive effects. Something that they enjoyed when they were young. I suppose it could be useful for sort of alarm system which could be seen from afar?"

embeds.title: Captain Reynolds
embeds.description:
"Hmm, yes.  I could envision a use for it even among our non-magic-wielding troops.  Well, any of these three items you're willing to part with, you'll be given the fifty gold pieces for.

As for the promise of a Gnome-engineered ballista, that's a little stickier.  I'm not sure I can authorize Lance funds for something that is not yet available _and_ requires troops and resources to fetch.  I can bring it up with Lord Filmarya when I next report, and have an answer for you when you return from your next task.

Now, the matter of the bracer - I'm afraid I have no eye for details such as this.  Any one of the dozens of adventurers I have met may have been wearing it.  I am simply grateful you did not share this one's fate.  You were wise to stay out of the Dragon's sight."

"That's uh... disappointin' tah hear Captain, but we understand the situation yer in. However havin' seen first hand the ingenuity of the gnomes, both in magic and defensive weaponry, I can vouch fer the usefulness these ballista would be to yeh. If it comes to it and an escort for pickup is needed please consider us first. And when you see how useful it is I reckon you'll pay us honestly what it's worth.

Now as for these... I have plans for the gold already. I'll hand over the rod to yeh. Once this dragon issue is dealt with, and if we all survive, I'd ask the chance to buy it back from yeh at cost."
_Rowan takes the arm bracer back and tucks it away._

*Storm retrieves the hat and puts it back on his head.*

"This one will hold onto the hat in this case while we continue contract work. When the time comes for the Lances to have need for it, then you may take it."
"All would be needed is a good sturdy cart, one used to transfer stone, a couple horses and you would have yourself a function ballista."

embeds.title: Captain Reynolds
embeds.description: "Well now, to be clear, I didn't rule out chance of payment, I merely said I would need to consult with Lord Filmarya first.  My hands are tied, I'm afraid - but you've granted enough evidence of the Gnomes' capabilities and willingness to help that I feel confident I can make a good case."
"So for now it looks like we'll be submitting two magical items to the Lance's. How does that sound?"
"And we look forward to what Lord Filmarya has to say regarding the ballista work order upon the report of our next contract."

embeds.title: Captain Reynolds
embeds.description: "It is much appreciated.  Geoffrey?"
You watch as the young man counts out coin from a purse attached to his belt, transferring it to a small pouch which he then deposits on the table in front of you.

embeds.title: Geoffrey
embeds.description: "Here you are, sirs.  One-hundred gold pieces - fifty per item."

*As Geoffrey hands off the gold to his companions, Storm steps forward once again.*

"There is another thing we would like to discuss Captain. This one has hard troubling rumors regarding the run down district north of the port. In particular of the Manyclaw Alley. 

Have the Lance's investigates these rumors in the last or have any resources to do so? If the manpower cannot be spared, this group could find some time to investigate the dangers."

*Storm bows.*

"Apologies but this one has realized some words have been misused. Common is not my native tongue but I trust you understand my meaning." *He laughs.*

embeds.title: Captain Reynolds
embeds.description: "Manyclaws Alley?  The Lances have enough to deal with at the moment without taking old wives' tales and superstitions into account.  That's a rough part of Leilon, and the way I figure it, the thugs and thieves have just found a fun way to make sure nobody interferes with their nefarious business.  As ideal as it would be to restore the area, we simply cannot spare the resources, especially now.  Of course, you are free agents and may do as you wish - but for what it's worth, I believe your time would be better spent giving tangible aid against the larger threat looming over us."

*Storm nods in agreement.*

"Very well Captain. If we can find time to look into these tales and discover anything of use, we will report them to you. But as you say, our time is better spent against the immediate danger that threatens you all."

*Storm steps back and bows.*

embeds.title: Captain Reynolds
embeds.description: "_(Nods)_ I do wish you Tyr's protection as you undertake your new tasks, and look forward to your safe return."
*Rowan tips his hat with a nod and a simple "Captain." and heads outside.*

_Cain nods and follows Rowan outside the tent._

"Twenty-five gold each, that's not a bad haul for a few days worth of work."

"How was the job board looking this morning, was there anything interesting for us?"
"Suppose we have ourselves a little way to spend our time between the tavern and jobs for the Lances.  Good day to you Captain."  _Govath follows out on the heals of Cain._
*Rowan hands Cain the two job parchments.* "There were three jobs left. These two caught my eye as I have a tad of expertise concernin'em."
*Storm leaves the tent and joins the group, peering over at the two contracts Ruggo picked, eager to know what they say.*
_Holdimg a contract in each hand, Cain reads them out loud to the group..._

"Orcs have attacked Butterskull Ranch, five miles east of Conyberry along the Triboar Trail. Travel there with haste, assess the damage, and assist any way you can. The owner, Alfonse Kalazorn, is a retired sheriff who can reward you for your efforts. If he's dead, return to Captain Reynolds with proof of his demise and you will be compensated 100gp."

"Deep in Neverwinter Wood, along the river that flows west toward Neverwinter, is a logging camp which supplies much of the region's lumber.  The surrounding cities and towns have an agreement to rotate providing fresh supplies to the camp.  The responsibility of doing so falls to Leilon at this time.  Wynn has organized a new delivery, but under the circumstances the Lances are looking for capable hands to ensure the supplies arrive safely to the camp.  Return to Captain Reynolds with a notice of delivery signed by Tibor Wester to claim a reward of I00 gp."
"Hmm, the first does seem to be more urgent. Have you been to Butterskull ranch before Rowan?"
"Never been to the ranch, it's just on the other side of Neverwinter Wood, and I have a vested interest in these Orcs. Seein' em dead I mean."
"Just out of Tabaxi curiosity, what was the third job post regarding?"
"It was an escort mission with some uppity landowner. Take him from here to his mine northeast of Phandalin. I don't find that kinda company...agreeable? Enjoyable? Pick one a those."
"Though if yeh rather choose that job over one a these, I'm sure it's still available. Since a lot of the help has been gettin' eaten."
"No, I agree with you. Guiding people can be a...hassle."
"I agree, these sounds to be the best jobs of the three.  When is the best time to head out?  Do any of you need supplies?"
"I do need a stopover at the Lionshead Coster. I feel... inspired to try my hand at a new weapon."

"We need to pay Lyla still and this one wouldn't mind a quick stop at Wynn's which seems like a necessity since one contract refers to him. I can head to Wynn's and see the nature of these supplies we are to bring to the Neverwinter Wood."
"Do we think we have the ability to do both contracts in one trip? If the supplies require a cart, it might be best to make two."
"We can take the cart to Neverwinter and then head to Butterskull  on the way back to Leilon."
"That's a good idea actually, sounds like a plan to me.  I think I'll join Rowan ... After those encounters in Gnomengarde, I've realized I'm really lacking in the ranged department."
"I will head to Wynn's Wares and see about these supplies for the camp. Shall we meet back at the Sword?"
"Good idea, Red. We'll pay our tab and get out to the open road before high noon."

"That sounds good. Enjoy your weapon shopping."

*Storm heads off towards Wynn's Wares.*
_Rowan heads off in the direction of the Lionshield Coster nodding to Cain to follow._
"Well, seeing as all avenues are covered, I will wander around town for a bit.  Where shall we meet after our respective errands are complete?  The usual tavern?"

"Storm suggested the Sword, so let's reconvene there before noon. Make sure you stay away from that alley."

_Cain heads out to the Lionshead_
"So Cain, what yeh thinkin' of buyin' with yer newfound riches?"
"Ah right, he did mention something about paying the bill.  That will work for this one."

_As Cain walks with Rowan to the Lionshield, he begins to strike up a conversation._

"So, looking to try a new weapon? From what I've seen, you're a pretty deadly shot with that thing. In fact, it's the reason why I'm coming, to get something I can use in case we find ourselves at a distance."

"What are you thinking of wielding?"

"Thinkin' of goin' back to my roots. Classic longbow. This here bowgun is somethin' I picked up only a few years ago, been meanin' to tinker around with it, see if I can get a faster load time but... hard to find time these days. What're yeh lookin for yerself?"

"Deadly and long ranged, I like the sounds of that. Me, I've never used a bow and don't think I'll be starting any time soon. After Govath lended me those daggers during our encounter with the mimics, I've been thinking of picking up a set of throwing knives. I've always been good at chucking things." _he laughs._
"Yer quite a good fighter yerself, impressive for a...clerk? Jus' good survival instincts or yeh trained before?"

"A clerk!? I work in shipping ... were you not listening when I was explaining how all of this --" _he waves his hands over his face_ "-- happened?"

"But moving cargo is a dangerous business on the open roads away from guarded towns and cities, you learn a few things about self defense and survival for sure. "
"My mistake, I reckon I hear shipping and think paperwork. So yer more of a travelling bodyguard for merchandise? Looks like our current job is right up yer alley."

"More the logistics person on the trip. We'd have hired guards and freelancers to do the dirty work, but everyone had to be prepared regardless. But this new contract is certainly in my area of expertise."

_Cain pauses for a second, contemplating if he should ask. He decides to and says,_ "Speaking of contracts, what's the deal with what you said earlier, about killing orcs. I hate orcs as much as the next guy, but to actively  seek and destroy seems to imply some history with them."

"They're a big threat back home. Years ago when I was a Reav.... *hunter*, we dealt with any orcs in the High Forest. I have a knack for killin'em. Anywho, I've been meanin' to ask yeh, and don't think I been snoopin', but I noticed you carryin a magical trinket..."

_Cain abruptly stops walking and turns to Rowan,_ "Sorry, let's back up a second. Did you just say --" _and in a whispered voice_ "_reaver_?"

"Is that why you're so awkward around them? Because you know them? ..."

_Thoughts of realization race through Cain's head,_ "**That's** why you disguise yourself here ... And probably why you've been hanging out in Leilon, you've been following them, haven't you?"

"And I didn't want to bring it up at the tent, and I don't know if the others noticed, but what's happening with your eye? There's a lot you've been secretive about."

"I mean ... Are you even a --" _Cain then proceeds to open hand slap the air above disguised Rowan's head, where his Firbolg head would be. _

messages.content: @Pleebz Do I have to make an attack before Rowan responds.

embeds.title: Cain Vance attacks with an Unarmed Strike!

fields.name: Effect
fields.value: You can punch, kick, head-butt, or use a similar forceful blow and deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1 + STR modifier

embeds.description:
*Rowan leans back and Cain's strike misses completely. He looks confused a second, then flashes his signature sideways grin.* 

"Oh sorry, I mistranslated. Yeh see Firbolgs don't have names. Fer anything. Back home I ain't Rowan or Ruggo or Rhododendron. But once yeh get out into society it's hard to make yer way without one. I reckon a closer approximation to the word I was lookin' for would be Shearer, but hunter is the function. I don't know the Reavers here though. Yeh have quite the imagination."
"And what's wrong with my eye?"

embeds.title: Cain Vance makes an Insight check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (**1**) + 2 = `3`
*Cain gauges Rowan's honesty.*

"Alright, well I suppose there's no reason not to trust you. Once you for battle with someone, you've become more than just strangers."

_Cain continues the walk to the shop_

"Your eye, one of them is darker than the other. I don't remember them being so mismatched, have you looked in the mirror at all this morning?"

*Rowan's face looks concerned.*

"That's...interesting. I didn't choose that detail when I disguised..."

*His voice drops quieter,* "I made a decision today. Somethin' a long time comin' Chose a path I've been avoiding since I left the High Forest. I reckon the eye is a symbol of that."
"If I ask, are you even going to explain?"
"I'm still waitin' to hear about that trinket you've been hidin'."

"Not hiding, just haven't had a use for it, but if you're so curious."

_Cain reaches into his pocket and takes out a gold coin and flips, catching it._

"When you travel around, you meet a lot of people. A  lot of shady ones too you can imagine, at the various pit stops along the way."

"Anyway, this one half elf was scamming the more innocent travellers with simple coin flip bets. Except, this one is embued with magic such that it always lands tail side up."

"Fortunately for me, he wasn't the brightest and I bet him half our goods (we were shipping luxury robes if I recall) for anything on him. He agreed."

" A simple _heads I win, tails you lose_ wordplay later and I now have this. So if you ever need to bet, let me know." _Cain laughs_

*Rowan shakes his head smiling.* "Bet that's mighty useful."

*They continue walking in silence until Rowan pipes up.* "Outta cigars too. Gonna have to make more, don't trust anyone fer that anymore..."
"I've never smoked, but I've shipped them before. The high quality ones are pretty expensive, so I can imagine what sort of knockoffs you could find in a smaller place like Leilon. "

"A travelling merchant promised me one that'd help me relax, had saved it till our last night after our success with the Gnomes. Didn't realize till after we were almost eaten he'd laced it with slumberweed. Could've cost us our lives."
_Cain chuckles,_ "Well, I suppose he wasn't lying. Good thing you waited to use it. "

Ruggo leads to the door of a medium-sized building just down the road from the barracks.  You notice a wooden sign hanging outside that is cut into the shape of a shield, and a blue lion is painted upon it.

As you enter, you notice the place has several other customers wandering about, examining various pieces of armour displayed on mannequins and weapons hung up on racks.  A Dwarf behind the counter, dressed in a blacksmith's apron, takes notice of you both as you walk in and addresses you with a boisterous, deep voice.

embeds.title: Fomner
embeds.description: "New customers!  Good mornin', and a hearty welcome to the Lionshield Coster!  I trust yeh'll find whatever yeh need, at fair price and top-notch quality - and if there's anythin' yeh need helpin' with, yeh just come fetch ol' Fomner and I'll set yeh straight!"

*Rowan unhooks the crossbow from his back and a full pack of 20 bolts, setting them on the counter.*

"Lookin' to do a little barterin'. I reckon I won't get full price for a used piece of equipment, but it's tip top shape. Hopin' yeh carry a longbow and fully stocked quiver for it. I'll pay the difference o'course."

embeds.title: Fomner
embeds.description: "A fine piece indeed, this one - longbows, you say?  Why, we've got ones that'd make the Elves of the High Forest covet 'em!  I'd be happy teh knock off half the price in exchange fer this here crossbow, and I'll trade the quiver'a bolts for the quiver'a arrows directly, leaving yer cost at twenty-five gold pieces total.  How's that sound to yeh?"
"Sounds jus' swell good sir. A pleasure..." *Rowan hands the man 25 gold pieces. He takes the bow and tests the torque.* "Jus' swell indeed."

_Cain browses the store until he finds a set of throwing daggers. Simple and effective. He gathers six of them and heads to the counter._

"Nice shop you have here, I'll be buying his set of throwing daggers if you don't mind. "

_He places 12 gold pieces on the counter._

embeds.title: Fomner
embeds.description: "Ah, and you won't find better ones anywhere yeh look along the entire Sword Coast, I guarantee yeh!  Balanced and crafted by me own hands, they were, from the purest and lightest steel.  They'll fly swift as the wind, they will.  Many thanks for yer patronage!"
"Come to think of it, I reckon I'm gonna be huntin' quite a bit the next few days. Might I pick up another quiverfull?"

embeds.title: Fomner
embeds.description: "Aye, we can stock yeh with arrows 'til they're comin' out yer ears, laddie!  A bundle'a twenty will run yeh a single gold piece, and I challenge yeh t'find a better price from any other merchant this side'a Yartar!"
*Rowan's eyebrows raise I'm impressed surprise.* "Single gold, yeh don't say! I will take that bundle off yer hands, mate. Thankee much. You'll be seein' me around here in the future that's forsure."
He tips his hat and heads out the door with his newfound goods.

Cain and Ruggo make their way back to The Sword of Leilon, waiting outside the door for a bit to enjoy the pleasant, cool summer day.  After a while, Govath arrives, followed by Storm.  The four of you make your way inside and pay a grateful Lyla the 3sp each that you owe for the night's stay.

As you prepare to leave, Lyla informs you apologetically that due to the declining number of patrons staying at the Sword, it's likely they'll have to revoke the discount for your further stays.
*Rowan tips her a gold with a wink and a smile.* "Aw don't worry bout that, Lyla. You know this little piece of paradise is worth ten fold."

*Storm pays Lyla with a grateful thank you and heads outside.*

"Wynn has prepared a cart of supplies and food for the logging camp in Neverwinter Wood. His son is just finishing hitching up their ox, Winnifred so she's ready to go when we are. This one promised to bring back Winnifred in healthy condition so let us keep good care of her on our journey."

*Patting down his gear and checking straps...* "Shall we begin our next adventure?"

_Having paid and thanked Lyla for the room Govath returns to the group outside._  "I have also found out about a possibly interesting detour that we can make along the High Road that could be dangerous but offer great reward.  Also, some details, or rather lack of details, about our alley we so unknowingly walked into last night."
"By this detour, do yeh happen to know if an ox drawn cart could traverse it?"
"Hmm, we would have to see when we get there.  It would involve going off road to the coast.  I do not know what to expect upon arriving at the destination however."
"And this information about the alley sounds very interesting...do tell!"

"Remember I did say lack there of.  I was speaking to a fellow down by the docks, an information broker of sorts.  When I brought up the alley to see what was know, he looked visibly afraid.  Now his sort are not ones to be afraid of much, which is telling in and of itself."

"The lances, as we already know, will have nothing to do with what goes on down there."

"He said that what goes on there is not the doing of any of the normal townsfolk, almost as if something or someone else has moved into that area and made it its home."

"And the part that makes it very interesting, none have returned alive, that have ventured down there."
"Are we the first to return alive? I get a feelin' that corpse was the warnin' for anyone that wants a closer looksee. We prolly would be among the dead if we went any further."
"It is possible, although we did not venture deep into the alley.  There must be more horrors further in."

"There is only one way to find out. The things you heard from the docks lines up with the things this one has heard as well. I think it's safe to say something sinister is happening there. And there's only one way to find out!

In regards to the detour to the coast, what sort of thing are you expecting to find there? What did you learn?"
"Seems to me, the safest route would be to take the highroad directly to Neverwinter, stay the night there and then head along the river into the woods. What sort of reward would a detour provide?"

"There is an old lighthouse about a day north that is no longer in service.  However a few travellers noticed it one night all lit up.  This can pose a problem to sailors unfamiliar with the area running their ship aground, and if a group is using this to lure unknowing cargo ships to their demise I think they need to be stopped."

"Interesting ... a day north from Leilon, or from Neverwinter? It would certainly be a little bit of a challenge hiding a cart full of goods, but I nothing that isn't impossible, especially for a professional shipper such as myself. What exactly is in it for us, if we were to investigate the lighthouse?"
"From Leilon, so not far from where we are currently.  And in regards to the cart, I would expect nothing less from our own experienced goods merchant."
"Well we help the sailors by making their passage safer, and should there be a stock pile of goods collected, then it should do in paying us for our service."
"Stolen goods though ... but if you believe its worth it, I'd be open to having a look. What do you two think?" _Cain asks Rowan and Storm._
"That actually sounds like it'd work. I never thought t'spend an overnight in Neverwinter fer this, but come teh think of it now I reckon it's a good plan."

"As long as ol' Winny can make the journey to the coast, it would be worth investigating. Having come here by ship from Chult, the original destination was to be Neverwinter for myself. But the Dragon rumors on the docks in Leilon kept me there that day. If there are pirates or brigands using the lighthouse to crash or raid ships, than I wonder what would have happened had this one stayed aboard the Compass Rose. I hope the ship made it to Neverwinter afterall...

Let us check out the lighthouse on our way to Neverwinter."

"Besides, this one could use a little more coin...I am running low again. I found a few whimsical wares at Wynns' again. This one needs to stop going in there." *Storm chuckles and pats his sad looking coin pouch which looks extremely slim.*

"Come, let us retrieve the cart and be on our way."

*Storm leads them to Wynns' Wares, to Winnifred, and beyond!*
"If that is decided, then let us be on our way.  No one required anything else right?"
*Rowan unhooks his new longbow and pats it, testing the string tension.* "Rarin' to break this beaut in."
"It is good to be going on another adventure with you all. May Ubtao's blessing be upon us again!"
"Here's hoping to no rain this time." _Cain follows Storm_
"...You know...in the Jungles, we call the rain a blessing of Ubtao. Maybe the rain has been my fault. Oops."
"Naw, I'm with yeh, Red. Rain is a good thing."

The four of you make your way to Wynn's Wares, where Wyliam has finished yoking Winnifred to the wagon.  He's clearly expecting you and gives you a nod as you load your own things onto the back and climb aboard.

messages.content: Now, the age-old question - who takes the reins?
Cain will take the reins because of his experience doing these sorts of trips. He should be quite comfortable carting a heavy load around.

embeds.description: Cain hops up to the front of the wagon, grabbing the reins.  After making sure you're all aboard, he coaxes Winnifred forward, and you make your way to the northern entrance of town, passing through to the High Road.  The lovely weather and warmth of noon have you in excellent spirits as you pass by other travellers making their way between Neverwinter and Leilon with a smile and a wave.  It's not the fastest way to travel, but it's nice to be able to rest your legs for a change.  Govath keeps an eye out for the mysteriously-active lighthouse as you ride along, thankful for the clear day and the slight elevation of the High Road above the coastline.  Just as you pull off to the side of the road to break for dinner, its shape can be faintly made out to your west, a mere pinprick at this distance, but stark in contrast to the sea beyond.
*Rowan squints into the distance.* "Looks kinda ominous."

*Storm disembarks after riding on the cart for a little while. Patting ol'Winny he begins to sort out a spot for the campfire.*

"As Govath has learned, it should not be active anymore. Let us watch it tonight and see if it is lit."
"Sounds like a fine plan."
"Ruggo, will you hunt tonight? I have a favor to ask of you once camp and dinner is prepared."

*Dropping his pack into the cart and securing his new quiver on his back, Rowan turns to Storm of Fire.* 

"Jus' about to head out on a hunt."

"Just a quick question about this lighthouse before we begin camping chores, who exactly told you about it and why hasn't Leilon or Neverwinter investigated before? It's not exactly that off the beaten path."

"The lighthouse is probably still within the jurisdiction of Leilon. They can't spare the Lance's to investigate their own city's problem of the Manyclaws Alley. They must know about the lighthouse but cannot look into it. I bet if we fix the problem, if there is a problem, the Captain may reward us."

"I imagine Storm is right in that the Lances have their hands full right now.  But it also takes a certain type of individual to put lighthouse and pillage ships together.  I will leave the rest of the _who_ to your imagination.  All I can say is we will need to proceed cautiously."
"Yeh gonna wait till I'm back with game to ask me that favour, Red?"
"Well if you have a moment before heading out...can you cast your magic and see if you find a magical presence on me?"
*Ruggo looks at the Tabaxi quizzically, but casts Detect Magic.*
_And as he casts the spell, his human form morphs once again into the 8ft tall blue Firbolg._
*Storm tosses off his hat and tosses it to the side before doing a slow spin for Ruggo to examine.*

messages.content: Correction; takes off his hat and tosses it to the side...

embeds.description: "I can uh... differentiate between different magical things, heh."
"Oh sorry, I did not know if my hat would interfere with the spell. Well, do you see anything?"
"Gettin' to it. I think yeh need a couple more spins. Wanna be thorough." *Ruggo has the most selfserious look on his face as he says it.*
Ruggo doesn't notice any unusual magical presence, other than those he is already familiar with.
"Not seein' anything, mate. Is that what yer expectin'?"
"Yes I was just curious. Picked up a few things from Wynn's, but you never know where he gets his things from. Can never be too sure. This one will get started on the fire, kla'kalli Ruggo."
*Storm picks up his hat and puts it back on. Taking off his Lute and bag, he puts together the camp site.*
"Kla...kalli..." *and Ruggo heads off to hunt.*

Hunting near a well-travelled road is more difficult than in the wilderness, as game has learned to keep its distance.  This, in addition to your adjusting to a new weapon, makes the hunt more challenging than normal.

messages.content: The DC for this hunt is increased by 5.  Go ahead and make your Survival check

embeds.title: Rowan "Ruggo" Rhododendron makes a Survival check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (9) + 6 = `15`
*Ruggo tries to get as far away from the road as he can, looking for game but also any plants he can use for cigars.*

_In the meanwhile, Cain prepares Winifred for the night, preparing her dinner from supplies found on the cart, and making sure everything is strapped down accordingly - a habit he deceloped from the years of doing shipment trips; you never know when bandits might come upon you and a quick getaway needed._

_Once done, he heads over to the fire and waits for everyone to finish it up their chores. _

You're a fairly quick learner, and after a couple of misses, you manage to hit a couple of small birds flitting from tree to tree in an area off the High Road.  You supplement the mediocre gain of meat with some berries and nuts you manage to find, as well as enough appropriate leaves to keep your cigar supply going for a couple of days.  You won't quite be making up for the rations consumed earlier in the day, but at least you'll have a fine dinner.

**Each party member gets:** 1 Ration, 1 Water
_*Ruggo returns with his kill slung over his shoulder. He says nothing as he drops his gear and starts cleaning the birds of feathers. He's in a bad mood most likely from the scarce meat.*_

embeds.title: Govath Forgearm makes a Survival check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (11) + 1 = `12`
*Seeing Ruggo go off, Govath collects some wood.*

_Seeing Rowan head out on the hunt, Cain catches Govath before his trip and waves Storm over_

"Listen, I'm not one to waste time gossiping, but something is off with Rowan. He was telling me about his life back at home, and almost said he used to be a reaver, or at least it sounded like it before correcting himself. I poked him about it and he chalked it up to a translation mistake."

"He hasn't given me reason to not trust him these last few days, so I'm going to give him the benefit of the doubt, but just thought you two should know."

"Also, I dont know if you noticed his eye is a different colour ... He said he figured it was a symbolic change because last night he _choose a path he's been avoiding_ since leaving his home. Of course, he was just as vague as always and didn't elaborate."

*Storm stops working and listens to Cain.*

"Rowan is a very awkward when it comes to attention and seems to hide much when asked. Though I do not doubt his heart or intentions. Maybe he is on the run from something like yourself. 

Those his connection with the Reavers is growing more apparent if he let slip that piece of info accidentally. Perhaps next time we seen them, which I do not wish for, we should indirectly ask them what they think of Firbolgs.

I did notice his eye but didn't want to ask. He doesn't like to talk about himself so I figured maybe it was part of his human disguise though I did notice his Firbolg self still maintains it. 

Either way, he does good work and fights hard. This one does not worry of bad intentions from him. He does what he does and does it well. But thanks for letting us know, maybe we should see what else he lets slip."

"That is all true, but who does not have a secret or two.  Let up hope that this reaver business does not lead to trouble down the road.  I have heard from my asking around that they are a group that will kill first and completely skip the asking of questions.  I best go find that wood now so we can have a good fire ready to cook whatever Ruggo finds."

Govath manages to collect a modest pile of wood that should suffice to keep the fire going for dinner and a while afterward.  The four of you opt to wait until it gets darker to light it so that you can enjoy its warmth before sleeping.  Ruggo quietly prepares the birds and divides up the berries and nuts, and you enjoy your first meal of your new task along the side of the High Road.
_After Ruggo wolfs down his meager meal, he spends the next hour rolling cigars with the plants he gathered._

*While Storm is eating, he pulls a few things out of his bag to show the group.*

"Look at these weirdly, whimsical, wares of Wynn that I was able to barter off his collection."

*Storm places a small model of a windmill with a strange architecture.* "Wynn got this off a wanderer who says the design is from a far off land and the design is certainly nothing I have ever seen. Have any of you in your travels?" *He gives a gentle spin of the windmill blades, and it's clear by how they're weighted that they will continue spinning for a very long time unless purposely stopped.*

*Placing it next to him to spin, he pulls out another very strange object. It's a construct of a bulbous, hideous looking creature. It has three arms and a large maw in the center facing upwards. Storm retrieves a copper piece from his pouch which looks like one of very few coins in there. He then places it on the indentations of one of the claws and you watch the contraption move and the beast "eats" the coin. The coin clanks into its body and settles with whatever else is inside.*

"It's some strange coin bank or something. Wynn hasn't figured out how to retrieve the coins so that's a copper piece this one won't be getting back any time soon. Have any of you seen a monster like this before?"

*Rowan moves closer to inspect both objects.* 

"I ain't seen anythin' like either of em. Have yeh tried puttin' yer finger in the mouth?"
"Haven't had much time, but I will inspect it tonight. Speaking of which, keep your bird bones."

"Interesting contraptions for sure. This monster in particular is frightening, I hope this isn't something we'll have to face in our travels."

"I wonder the riches this one has inside ... " _Cain shakes the monsterbank_
You hear a small group of coins bouncing around, maybe four or five total.
"Hm, maybe not." _he hands it back to Storm._
_After finishing the bird and washing it down with some dried meats Govath takes and inspects the coin bank to attempt and glean how it works._

embeds.title: Govath Forgearm makes an Investigation check!

embeds.description: You turn the device over in your hands a few times, running your hands along the wood-and-metal exterior until eventually your fingers rest over a portion of the creature's belly that feels slightly different in texture than the rest.  You probe the area a little further, applying pressure until you hear a soft click.  Suddenly, the interlocking teeth open up and you feel the release of a spring mechanism within, and five copper pieces erupt from the maw, showering all around you.  After a few seconds, the interlocking teeth slide back into place, sealing the interior once more.
"Now is that not an interesting contraption.  Very well made indeed.  Looks as if you have your copper back Storm, and some extra to spend at his shop."

*Ruggo throws another log on the fire..* 

"What're we gonna do fer watch tonight. Im kinda eager to redeem m'self, and set yer minds at ease about my capabilities."
"Well, you're welcome to if you really feel the need. I can take the other watch, since its about my rotation. Which slot do you prefer?"
"I'll take second this time if yeh don't object. Or have two of us up at once each shift?"
*Storm thanks Govath for showing him how to open the box and puts the 5 pieces of copper into his coin pouch.*
"We don't need two on watch. You can take the first and I'll take the second."
*Ruggo lights up one of his freshly rolled cigars and nods,* "As yeh want."
*Storm spends some time working out the bones of the bird into his Tome before sleeping. *

As darkness falls and the fire begins to shrink to embers, three of you set up your bedrolls and fall asleep easily, catching glimpses of the stars between the moving clouds above as you doze off.  Ruggo sits by the fire, his vision extending farther in the darkness than it did before, determined to prove himself a capable watch this time around.

messages.content: @Wolverbane Go ahead and make that Perception check

embeds.title: Rowan "Ruggo" Rhododendron makes a Perception check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (4) + 4 = `8`
*Ruggo watches the lighthouse as his ears are perked for nearby sounds of movement.*

As you peer down to the shore, you do notice a faint light emanating from the direction of the lighthouse.  What's far more noticeable, however, are distant flashes of lightning over the open waters beyond.  You think it a little strange that the weather could be so dramatically different a mere ten to fifteen miles away, but the wind seems to be blowing southwest so you're not overly concerned.

The High Road is well-travelled and generally quite safe, so you spend most of your time with your eyes on the eastern skies for any signs of a White Dragon.  However, your hours pass without sighting or other incident.

*Ruggo extinguishes the rest of his cigar and rouses Cain.* "Quiet night." *he whispers.* "Saw a storm over the water. Lighthouse is definitely bein' used. Was wonderin' if we shoulda been approachin it by dark of night."

_Cain stretches and gets up_

"I suppose that could have been an option, but we'd have likely walked into a guarded stronghold, and no doubt they'd have scouts out."

"Anyway, have a good sleep "

_Cain posts up on a rock so he can have a good view of the lighthouse and surrounding areas of the High Road._

embeds.title: Cain Vance makes a Perception check!

embeds.description: "G'night." *Rowan unpacks his bedroll and reclines close to the fire, dozing off in no time.*

Cain also observes the lightning in the distance, which seems to subside shortly after his watch begins.  Around the same time, the dim light at the lighthouse fades away.  The hours pass, but no sound or sight gives you any cause to worry, and as dawn comes around, one-by-one the party wakes up.

embeds.title: Calendar of Harptos
embeds.description: 9th day of Eleasis (*Highsun*), 1481

embeds.title: Today's Weather: Coastal, Summer

footer.text: !weather list to see supported biomes and commands

embeds.description: As you awake, you clouds beginning to gather overhead, and get the feeling you're in for yet another wet day.  Strange, Ruggo and Cain think, since the wind should have been blowing the storm you observed the night before _away_ from you - perhaps the gods really are playing tricks on you after all.

*Ruggo packs up before any rain can get to his things.* 

"Must be some kinda road towards the lighthouse. We plannin' to drive the cart all the way?"
"I would like to leave it somewhere as we will need to watch our backs during our approach.  We should keep our eyes open for a natural hiding place for the cart as we travel to the lighthouse."
"We would often use small cave outcrops to park a cart, using branches and other foliage to create a camouflage cover. Give the ox enough food, and it'll stay put and quiet."

"This one really needs to stop asking for Ubtao's blessing."

*Storm bundles up in anticipation for the rain.*

_Cain packs his gear, preparing for yet another rainy day._

"Do you find it strange that the winds were blowing in the opposite direction last night, yet the storm that formed has come over us?"
"Strikes me as a tadbit funny, yeah. That storm in general seemed...off. When I woke yeh the wind was heading southwest forsure."

"Makes you wonder if there's some foul magic at play ... use the lighthouse and winds to blow passing ships into the coast. Anyway, we'll just have to be careful either way. I'm ready to head out when everyone else is."

_Cain prepares the Ox and cart for the day's trip._
*Storm climbs up ontop of the crates supplies and gets comfortable.*
_Ruggo walks beside the cart, his 8 ft stride able to keep pace._

The clouds above grow ever-darker and more threatening as you go, but the rain seems to  hold off as you cut your way off the High Road, heading west towards the shore.  Search though you might, whatever path may have once connected the High Road to this lighthouse is long gone.  Winnifred and the wagon are both sturdy, however, so your progress is not dramatically slowed - and after about four hours of travel, you find yourself near the edge of a cliff which overlooks the beach below.  About two-hundred feet ahead of you, just above eye-level, you see a large outcropping of rock almost completely surrounded by water, atop which is a stone building from which the lighthouse tower rises.  You can faintly make out a narrow causeway connecting the outcropping and the beach, but it appears to be completely submerged in water at the moment, suggesting you have arrived at high tide.

Glancing over the edge of the cliff to the beach below, something immediately catches your eye.  Pacing back and forth along the beach below is what appears to be a _massive_ crab, easily fifteen feet wide from claw to claw.  Casting your eyes a little south of your position, you do notice that a set of stairs has been hewn into the cliffside, leading down to the water's edge.
"We should find a place to hide outta sight from the lighthouse and the path we came from."
"Ruggo, you're a man of the wild. This one has to travelled the coast much to know, but when will the tide be low enough for us to traverse the other side?"

embeds.title: Rowan "Ruggo" Rhododendron makes a Nature check!

embeds.description: Despite Storm's words, Ruggo's experience lies primarily inland, not near the coast at all.  Tidal patterns are not his specialty, and it's not something they teach young Firbolgs in his forest clan.
"Can't help yeh there, mate. Not a seafarin' man m'self I'm afraid."

"Well first things first, we need to find somewhere to park and hide our cargo while we wait for the tide to lower. Look for any small outcroppings and overhangs. Stay away from large caves though, I have some bad stories to share about that ..."

embeds.title: Cain Vance makes a Perception check!
embeds.description:
2d20kh1 (~~3~~, 12) + 4 = `16`
*Cain uses his experience moving cargo on dangerous roads to find a place to park their cart. Rowan helps, of course.*

There's not a ton of cover atop the cliff you're standing on, but you find a small cluster of trees and bushes nearby which you figure you could tie Winnifred to and let her graze.  It doesn't fully mask the wagon's presence, but it's clear that not many stray from the High Road to come out this way, since you were unable to find any trodden path to follow yourselves.

_After the cart has been tucked away best it can, Govath takes a look at the surrounding area._  

"Perhaps this storm will give us some good cover and mask our presence should an opportunity arise to make our way to the lighthouse.

As it stands, we have time to kill waiting for the tide to go out.  Anyone care to explore the area?"

_Cain takes some loose branches and foliage and covers the cart as best he can, making clear note of any landmarks that would help them find their way back to it when they return._

_After wrapping up Cain says,_ "We may as well get a lay of the land for sure."
"This one has always been a fan of seafood. That giant crab on the beach looks tasty..."
"That'll feed a village for a week. Might be us bein' eaten instead I reckon. Lookit the size of its claws!"
"Well...just throwing it out there that I would not be opposed to helping you hunt it. Well, let's have a look around while we wait for the tide to go down."

"We can all hunt that thing once we deal with whatever's happenin' here. Keep an eye on that lighthouse for movement. Do yeh reckon whoever lights it up at night leaves every morning, or sticks around inside?"

"It would be rather inconvenient if they had to travel out there every night.  Their best odds for trapping ships would be manning it constantly.  It is also a good defensive position.  Only one way in our out by land, and a view of any ships approaching."

"Certainly. The would only need to leave for supplies if any. They are probably sleeping inside the tower right now. If we can get across before the night, we could catch them off guard. Should one of us stake out the tower while the others scout around? See if there's any movement or activity before we head across?"
"We would have a rather difficult time crossing with the tide being in.  If the tide goes out before nightfall, I agree that would be an opportune time to cross."
"Well now hold yer horses a minute. If we cross in daylight jus' needs to be one guy looking out at us crossin' and all advantage of surprise is lost. We need cover of night."

"You know, there might not be an obvious route to this lighthouse, but its not like the lighthouse itself is that hidden. If these bandits are carting loads of ship cargo to wherever they store it, how do you figure they move it? Those are some very steep rocks ... maybe they have another method of accessing the tower?"

"Of course, maybe the bandits in the lighthouse have nothing to do with the actual cargo and are only there to distract the passing ships into the rocks and another group is responsible for the thieving."
"Hmm, mayhaps there's a cave system that goes under the tower. Let's have a looksee."

embeds.title: Rowan "Ruggo" Rhododendron makes an Investigation check!

embeds.description: The four of you take some time examining the area at the top of the cliff.  It's relatively flat, mostly grassy, and there are patches of trees and bushes scattered about, but certainly no cave openings or tunnels to be found.  Nothing interesting catches your eye as you search.
"Alright, I feel fairly confident we'dve found anythin' up here. Movin' on, mates?"

You begin to make your way down the stairs to the beach.  As you clear the rock wall and make it down to the water's edge, you glance to the right at the giant crab that was meandering around the beach.  To your surprise, it is turned directly toward you.  It has a single claw raised above its head, and is swinging it side-to-side, in a gesture that looks an awful lot like a wave.
"Uh, do yeh still feel it's right to eat somethin' that'll wave at yeh?"
"Only if it tries to kill you. Maybe it's just flexing it's claw muscles for the kill. Should we...go...to it?"
"I reckon I could try talkin' to it. What would I even say?"
"I like Storms idea.  If it tries to kill us, then dinner.  Otherwise it may be possible that it has some form of intelligence."

"Ahkay, I'm gonna see if it's friendly. Stay 30 feet behind me so we don't spook it." 

Ruggo walks towards the crab with hands out showing them empty with no weapons drawn.

"Hey there big guy. I'm a friend..."
*Storm keeps a careful eye out for anything waiting in ambush as Ruggo makes his approach.*

embeds.title: Storm of Fire makes a Perception check!

embeds.description: As you begin to approach, the crab lowers its mighty claw.  To your surprise, its mouth opens, and from it flows words in flawless Common, shouted over the crashing waves beside you.

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description: "Well-met, travellers!  I confess I was beginning to lose hope that anyone would come this way.  My name is Nigel, and I'm absolutely _delighted_ to make your acquaintance!"

*Ruggo stops in his tracks aghast.* "This new path must be more powerful than I thought....I can understand a crab clear as crystal!" *He says to himself.*

"Uh, nice teh meecha, Nigel. M'names Ruggo."

_Govath, with a very surprised look on his face says to Cain and Storm._ 

" Well I was not expecting that."

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description: "I cannot tell you what a pleasure, what an _unparalleled_ pleasure it is to see the four of you fine gentlemen.  The gloomy weather had certainly done a number on my spirits this morning, but its as though a ray of sunshine has pierced the shadowy veil to lift my weary heart to new heights.  Might I be granted the privilege of introductions to your three companions back there?  _(Shouting past Ruggo)_ Come, come!  Nothing to be afraid of!"
The creature lifts its massive claw once again, this time in a beckoning motion to the three of you standing at a distance behind Ruggo.

*Storm whispers to his companions.*

"I don't trust it."

"Niether ..." _Cain whispers back_ "... it's not natural for a creature like that to speak, and to be of that size. There is clearly some magics at work here, first with the unnatural weather formation and now this. Just be on your guard."
"Well, why not."  _Govath grins at his companions and approaches.  Once beside Ruggo he casually rests his hands in front of him on his sword hilt._  "My name is Govath."

*Storm follows behind Govath, still keeping a cautious eye on the flanks. Upon reaching the crab he bows.*

"Greetings. This one is called Storm of Fire of the Boundless Jungle clan."

*As his companions approach and reply to the crab realization dawns on Ruggo's face.* 

"Ah, you can all hear him."
"Worried about your sanity?  After that mushroom wine from the gnomes, perhaps we all should be."
"It's just I can usually talk to animals...they just never replied before."

_Cain follows Storm, last to approach the crab. He keeps an eye out towards the lighthouse to see if he can spot anyone watching them from above them._

"My name's Cain ... how does creature like you come to learn how to speak common?"
_Govath gives a slightly concerned look to Ruggo, but shakes his head and does not give it a second thought._

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description: "Ah, yes, I do beg your pardon - I often forget that I am more..._talkative_...than my kin!"
Nigel's eyes close and he makes a sound that you interpret as a chuckle - some weird combination of stuttered hissing and clicking - before continuing.

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description: "As it happens, the explanation of this _unusual_ phenomenon makes for a good introduction to why I am so delighted to see you all.  Cain, Govath, Storm of Fire, and of course, Ruggo - it is a pleasure to meet you all.  Would the four of you be willing to indulge old Nigel in both a tale and a request?  I am confident that I can offer compensation which would make it worth your while!"

"We're actually here on other, time sensitive business regarding that lighthouse."_ he points up to the cliff._ "Seeing as you're likely familiar with the surrounding area, if you could help us with our investigation we'd be open to hearing your request?"

_Cain turns to his companions and raises his eyebrow as if to ask *what do you think?*_
*Ruggo nods to Cain.* "If it's safe to be out here in the open. We don't want anyone lookin' down from there to see us."
"We have time to spare, please do, tell us you tale."
Nigel looks about as quizzical as a giant crab is able, bringing up one claw and rubbing it against the top of his head.

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description: "Business at the lighthouse, you say?  Forgive me, travellers, but might I inquire into the nature of your business?  I suspect there may be some overlap in our desires, unless I am severely mistaken."
"Our business there is for the betterment of common folk.  Stopping any wrong doing by those who have taken up residence in the lighthouse.  Or at least that is what we go to investigate."

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description:
"Then it seems indeed that our purposes cross. For you see, I too have business with the current occupant of the lighthouse.  But alas, it is probably best that I start from the beginning.

You see, my mistress, Miraal, took up residence in the lighthouse a couple of centuries ago.  As I understand it, she was a bit of a recluse, just looking for a place to live out her days undisturbed.  Except I suppose she got lonely, because about eighty years ago, she used her magic to grant me intelligence beyond my species, and we have been companions ever since.

That is, until a month or two ago, when a crazed Half-Orc burst through the doors of our quiet little home yelling about 'reclaiming the shrine of Talos' or some such thing.  My mistress bid me to flee, but stood her ground against the feral brute.  I managed to scramble my way out the door, but not before hearing a crack of thunder and a scream of agony - I knew in that instant that my one and only friendship had been brought to an abrupt end.

I fled to a nearby cave, unsure of what future lay ahead of me.  For what purpose have I without my mistress?  What existence can there be for an unusually intelligent crab?  Alas, I was not alone with my thoughts for long, for much to my surprise, I saw Miraal crawling her way after me into the cave's entrance.  But not in body - no, indeed not.  Only her twisted, groaning spirit clawed its way into that dark recess that fateful night.  'Mistress', said I, with horror at the sight before me. 'Why are you not at peace?'

'The conch!', she replied, with voice full of anger and anguish in equal measure.  'He has taken the _conch_!'"

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description:
"You see, Mistress Miraal was a practitioner of the arcane, and had a very special conch shell which she always had on hand when performing her magic.  I admit, such mysteries are beyond my understanding, but as near as I could comprehend her attempts to explain, the conch helped to _focus_ her arcane power. Never have I seen her treat another object with such reverence.

Travellers, what followed was a fit of rage so terrifying that I am ashamed to admit I _fled_ from my lifelong companion, fearing for my own safety.  Yet I cannot bring myself to leave this place until I know that her spirit has been put to rest.  Many long days and nights have I watched and waited, hoping that someone might come along with the strength and ability to aid in retrieving the conch and returning it to Mistress Miraal.

But never fear - I understand that such services do not come for free, and thus the aforementioned compensation comes into play.  For you see, since the Half-Orc took possession of the tower, it has lit at every low tide, without fail - and somehow, it always seems to storm while the lighthouse is lit.  Several small ships have fallen victim to the false promise of safety, and I have carefully scouted each.  I say 'carefully', for you see, Daggermaw and her companions swim in those waters, and I would prefer my eventual demise not be between the teeth of a shark.  Each ship contains things which I believe travellers like yourselves would find valuable, and if you help me lay my mistress to rest, you have my word that I will brave the beasts to retrieve one of these treasures for you.

Now, I know that is much to take in!  What say you, my new friends - will you help old Nigel out?"

*Storm listens the crab's story, taking in the details and mutters...* "...just wanted seafood..."

*Storm slapa Ruggo and Govath on the back.* "You guys got this!"

*He continues to watch the surroundings for danger. *

*Ruggo scratches his beard in thought.* 

"So it's jus one half-Orc then? That's some pretty good news fer us, eh fellas?"

"A half-orc that was able to deal with a well versed practitioner of the arcane arts.  Although it does indeed seem better than facing a whole band of mercenaries which I was expecting."

"I am for it.  Seems the reward is worth the risk, and we still have two more fine paying jobs to complete after this detour."

_Turning back to the crab._ 

"Can you tell us any of the layout of the lighthouse.  Are there any other entrances apart from the submerged one we see in front of us?"

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description:
"Unfortunately, the causeway you see before you is the only way to access the lighthouse.  It should be perfectly crossable come low tide, in the next five hours or so.

As for the building itself, it's fairly straightforward - once you ascend the stairs and enter the double doors, you'll find yourself in the foyer.  To your left is the room with the shrine which our Half-Orc adversary has revealed as being dedicated to Talos, and to your right are the stairs to the lighthouse tower, and well as a small living space.

However..."
The giant crab rubs its massive claws together nervously for a moment before continuing.

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description: "I'm afraid there _is_ one other challenge you will face.  You see, in the time since my mistress perished, it seems that a group of very aggressive Harpies have made their home in the building's courtyard.  More than once have I had to dive into the sea to avoid their aggression.  Once you cross the causeway, I imagine you will catch their attention and perhaps be viewed as an easy meal."
*At the mention of harpies Ruggo's sideways smile grows wide.* "That so? Well we've some experience with those buggers. A little archery practice is more than welcomed."
Nigel relaxes considerably at your confidence about the situation.

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description: "Then it appears I am even more fortunate than I had initially realized, now that the four of you have arrived!"
"This time let us wear ear plugs so we aren't hindered by their music. *Storm chuckles.*"

"That's not a bad idea."

"It looks like we have a about five hours to kill, what do you all suggest we do in the meantime? Unless of course ..."_, Cain turns to Nigel,_ "... you take passengers?"
_Govath rubs his beard._  "Strangely enough I would not mind hearing that siren song again, although I certainly would not cherish walking into the ocean.  Ear plugs it is."

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description: "Passengers?  Hmm...well, I suppose I could carry one of you at a time, if your grip is strong.  It would be slow-going, and you'd have to climb your way up the rock wall.  Of course, if the harpies spot you clambering up the wall, I'm not sure how well you'd be able to defend yourselves against an assault.  Nonetheless, the four of you are more experienced in these things than I!  I will defer to what course of action you decide it best."
"I'm not inclined to go for that idea to be honest. But if the rest o'ya wanna, I can back yeh up with some cover fire."
"Nigel, tell us about the half-orc. By the sounds of your tale he came alone. What weapons did he carry or would you describe him as an arcane user such as your mistress?"
"And the spirit of your mistress, where is the cave that her unrestful spirit resides in? The place where we should return the conch to?"

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description:
"The Half-Orc carried no weapon on his person that I noticed during my brief encounter.  Given the swiftness with which he extinguished my mistress' life, and the crack of thunder which brought about her demise, I can only assume he has a knack for the arcane himself.

As for my mistress' spirit, as far as I know it continues to reside within the cave over yonder, where I fled that fateful night."

He points one claw west over the water, and you see that a smaller outcropping of rock juts up out of the water, about half way between the beach and the land where the lighthouse resides.  The causeway rises higher at that point and seems to carve its way directly through the centre of the stone, though you cannot see the referenced cave from your current position.

"Do we run the risk of crossing paths with Miraal when we walk along the path? I imagine we'd want to avoid any contact with a restless spirit until we've found the conch?"

_And turning to the group,_, "Is anyone familiar with Talos?"

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description: "I imagine she would let you pass unhindered if made aware of your intention to return the conch to her. Perhaps she may even have further knowledge which would aid you in your confrontation - I have not been able to bear facing her myself since I fled her rage, and I did not have opportunity for inquiries beforehand."

"This one is not proficient in religion or its dieties but maybe there's something hidden in the lore of some old songs or stories I know. I will think upon it unless anyone else is more knowledgeable."
"Miraal's spirit could be worth asking about this _Talos._"

embeds.title: Storm of Fire makes a Religion check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (17) + 2 = `19`
*Storm tries to recall any religious lore about Talos from the stories, poems and songs he knows.*

You recall the name Talos, as he is widely recognized across all of Faerun - he is The Storm Lord, god of storms and destruction.  Usually depicted as a broad-shouldered, bearded man with a dark eye patch, he demands completely loyalty from his faithful and encourages their destructive behaviour.

*Storm searches his memory and stumbles on an old tale.*

"There is an old poetic story this one has heard performed before. Not one that I particularly enjoyed so I never learned it. But it told of a band of pirates that raided coastal villages and stole their women. It was comedic and over exaggerated but the deity Talos was mentioned a few times. Only vague memories are left but I do recall the pirates would pillaged and destroy as much as they could in their raids. And in return, Talos would bless them with the power to sink their enemies ships with power thunderstorms. Or something along those lines...

You know, now that I think back upon it, I'm not sure how it was meant to be comedic. Maybe that's why I never adopted it."

"It would seem to make sense that this follower of Talos would be half-orc. They seem to be loose cannons...*Storm thinks about Braccus and his mother's mounted head.*

This would also align with him claiming the tower as a shrine to Talos. Those storms we've been witnessing can only mean the half-orc is definitely performing some sort of ritual in there."
"Talos seems to be a deity that would be chaotic in nature. I think we have a pretty good picture of what we are dealing with here."

"Also why Nigel heard a crack of thunder ... perhaps some attack spell used by the half-orc."

"I think we pretty much have everything we need to head to the lighthouse once the tide lowers. In the meantime, should we prepare our earplugs?"

_Cain pulls out his candle from his backpack._
"Nigel, any other things we should know about the tower? Traps or hidden things you might know about that might aid us in settling your mistress' spirit?"

embeds.title: Storm of Fire makes an Insight check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (4) + 3 = `7`
*Storm watches Nigel carefully...*
_Govath aids Cain in melting down the candles and preparing them into makeshift earplugs.  Shaving some material off some extra cloth to coat the outside of the wax earplugs with._

_With Govath's help, Cain creates eight small balls of wax and distributes them to everyone._

"Warm them up with your hands to soften them, and then place it into your ear, which should act like a mould. We best wait until we're near the harpies before putting them on though, since we're likely not going to be able to hear each other that well otherwise."

*Taking the little balls of wax, Ruggo  rubs them in his palms before pressing them tightly into his ears.* 

"WORK PRETTY GOOD. I CAN'T EVEN HEAR THE OCEAN NOW."
Nigel once again rubs his claws against his head, contemplating Storm's question.

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description: "I think that's about all I can think of.  I haven't been inside the lighthouse since my mistress' murder, so I cannot tell what mechanisms our adversary may have prepared in that time.  But I feel very confident that Mistress Miraal's only desire is for her conch to be returned to her."
He doesn't appear to be holding any information back, though it's the first time you've really attempted to read a crab's facial expressions.

*Storm pats the crab on his head.* "Do not fear, we will take care of anything!"

*Storm smells his paw and the scent of seafood fills his nose. His stomach grumbles...*

*He then ponders on his knowledge of the Common language.*

"Apologies...we will take care of *everything*. This one still mixes up those two words."
"Nigel, is there a good place of cover to wait out fer the tide to go out without any half-orc eyes on us?"
Nigel skitters around in a little circle, his beady eyes looking this way and that.

embeds.title: Nigel
embeds.description: "I suppose you could wait atop the cliff you descended from.   Besides that, I am afraid we are on a beach, and the lighthouse towers over us."

The four of you find a place to settle as inconspicuously as possible and wait for the tide to go out.  As the hours pass, the sky above grows even darker, and pretty soon the first rain begins to fall.  You do your best to stay dry under the shelter of the cliff, but as light rain turns to downpour you eventually accept your fate.  Despite the volume of water falling, however, you watch as the water begins to recede, and eventually you make out the causeway above it.
